4.6 Continued

Private vs. Public key Cryptography
Private key | Definition

A cryptosystem where knowing the encryption function facilitates
knowledge of decryption function

Example 5

Name \qquad\qquad Key \qquad Encryption Function \qquad\qquad Decrption Function

Public Key | definition

A cryptosystem where knowing the encryption does nothing to know the decryption key

Example | RSA

Encryption key: (n, e)

â\bulletâ n=pâqpâq n=p\cdot q\qquad p\cdot q\spacen=pâqpâq  are large primes (200+) digits

Encryption Method
1.) {A,B,C, ..., Z} -> {00,01,...,25}
2.) Concatenate the digits into one string
3.) Divide the string into k blocks size L
L is the largest number such that
25â25âââ25<n25\cdot 25\cdot\cdot\cdot 25 < n25â25âââ25<n
L - digits
4.) Now the string is composed of blocks m1,m2,ââmkm_{1},m_{2},\cdot\cdot m_{k}mâ1ââ,mâ2ââ,ââmâkââ
where each mim_{i}mâiââ is an integer with L digits. Encrypt each block using
Ci=mie mod n\qquad\qquad C_{i} = m_{i}^{e}\space mod\space nCâiââ=mâiâeââ mod n
5.) Concatenate the encrypted blocks
